reviews.review_msg: Awesome prof, funny and just an overall great teacher, would take another class with him if given the chance.
One of the best prof's I've ever had, fair marker and very clear in his teachings.

Dr. Helmus is easily one of the worst professors I have had. She goes out of her way on a regular basis to make condescending and sarcastic remarks about groups of people, usually targeting white people (I am Asian so this isn't me taking offense). Her exams are a total joke and she had to add extra % to the midterm due to a horrible average.

Maaike was a very kind lady, however, she was not a great professor. She obviously knows a lot about research methods, but was unable to communicate the material clearly. Test questions were very specific, and not written clearly. Additionally, she cancelled TA office hours halfway through the semester, which was unfair to the students!
Exams heavy and a lot of specific questions.
Never used the book. Read from the slides so lectures were not the best. Besides that, she was very caring and passionate about the subject.

She's by far the best prof you will ever have. I love her and wish i could take every class with her. a well educated person and very enjoyable to listen to, she has so much passion and i love her so much!

Absolutely loved her teaching! For those of you who dont like to read, she makes your job so easy with her lectures and nothing outside of the lecture material is tested on the exam. And for those who read and attend the lectures, An 'A' is on the cards. Clear and well- organized lectures. Not very difficult exams. Highly recommeded prof!
Super nice prof, but the class was hard. The paper is way to broad. its basically choose your own topic from anything you have interest in involving criminology. Hated it.

Amazing and caring prof who gives you comprehensive notes rendering the textbook basically unnecessary (it's pretty awful too) except for maybe the paper. As others said, her tests are easy, and the paper is long but just follow the guidelines and ask for help if you need it.

I LOVE STEPHANIE! I always looked forward to the lectures! Tests were fair, she really understands students and HELPS you learn. Lectures were super easy to follow and valuable. She is personable and easy to talk to - in lecture and in office hours. She is very natural, nothing seems forced or awkward so it's comfortable to listen to her. A+ prof

Fantastic professor. Cares a lot about her students and tries to make super dry content interesting. Everything you need to know comes from lecture, and the book is just for clarification if needed basically. Paper is straightforward but time consuming. Easy tests, and gives a study guide.

Course content is dry, but the class is not hard. The paper looks intimidating but the outlines break it down nicely. The textbook sucks, but she does a good job of explaining in lecture and she is very helpful if you go to her during her office hours. Marking is fair.

Super easy class and really nice prof! There is a mandatory 20 page paper but she provides extensive outlines making the paper a lot easier than it sounds. Also provided study guides for midterm and final. Would recommend!

She plans to talk about too much for one lecture and then goes through slides too quickly. She doesn't seem to be an experienced lecturer, as she says um alot and doesn't know how to pace herself. TA wasn't very useful for this class either.
Not easy but if you put some honest work into it, you'll be fine. He's really funny and easy on the eyes. Probably one of my favorite criminology professors of all time.
He was helpful even after I finished the course. He was very kind about returning papers (unlike many other profs I know). His extra effort makes you feel even better about showing up to lectures.

Martin is a great prof, very fair on assignments and exams. Mark breakdown was a bit weird - 5% each for two assignments, 40% for the proposal, 20% for the midterm, 30% for the final - small assignments are designed to prepare you for proposal, but end up taking a lot of time. Overall, amazing prof, I would definitely take a class with Martin again
This guy is a hot tamale.  He coordinated his outfits with his lecture slides!  Teaching is good, has a cute little French accent.  His exams were fair and easy.  Extremely helpful and approachable.

This class is really boring and all it is, is pretty much theory. The course is super dry and unexciting but the one bonus of this class is that the prof is so frickin hot. Also the prof is really helpful with his slides and he's a good lecturer. Take his classes, he's for sure the hottest prof I've ever had!!

It shows that he takes his job very seriously by the awesome slides that he makes for class. And that he dresses accordingly to what colour his slides are. :) He makes class interesting and just like everyone else have said; he's not bad looking either.

He's definitely easy on the eyes. I always attend his class and every time I'm there, I just want to sit closer to the front. I am sitting closer and closer to the front. :) Clear notes, endearing French accent, and an overall very patient person makes him one of my favourite profs at SFU. Have I mentioned that he's very good looking? :D
Martin is a really good prof. his notes are clear and he a really nice guy. His exams are totally fair. everything on the test was mentioned in class. HE is definately nice to look at!

I would not recommend  her. Her tests are fair, she marks the first assignment easy but she marks papers really hard. Even if you make one honest mistake in a sentence she will accuse you of plagiarizing. This semester she has a stack of assignments that she has reported as "plagiarizing" . She seems like she looks for excuses to report people.
Very well prepared

A true professional. He was approachable, sophisticated, and gave amazing feedback. Great attention to detail and was more than willing to give you more feedback then expected, I would love to take a class with him in the future. He could really help you take your writing to the next level if you work for it.

I had Ryan as a TA for my 220 class. He was phenomenal, incredibly hilarious and a really genuine guy. He made tutorials fun and refreshing and provided great feedback when it came to the research paper. He was generous when marking and set out great outlines for studying for exams. Thanks Ryan!
Very harsh marking rubric. Lectures are messy. A lot of reading. Prof is pretentious. Avoid.

Thoroughly enjoyed her class and her teachings. The course content was a bit heavy at times, but she was there to answer any questions and combat confusion. Definitely need to keep up with the class as there are lots of weekly quizzes, but all very short with few and easy questions. Was very clear about grading criteria. Enjoyed her class lots.
No Comments

Maybe better in-person than online.  Didn't upload anything to Canvas except point form list objectives, assignment briefs, and lecture videos.  Weekly office hours and midterm conflicted with other courses.  Little actionable feedback on assignments and didn't return midterm; how am I supposed to improve if I don't know why I got marked down?
Exams were ok. Research proposal instructions were very unclear. I would give her a 0 for helpfulness.
Do NOT be fooled by her nice first impression. She is very opinionated and expects you to agree with her. Terrible at explaining requirements for assignments.

Melissa is friendly and definitely knows what she is teaching! The lectures are boring but they contain a wealth of information (since you will not be able to get thru the horrible textbook). You will be confused about the research project but just ask questions and you will receive help. On this note, the TAs for the course were totally unhelpful!
Horrible choice of textbook but overall, she explains concepts well. Boring class overall...
Class was quite boring, might have just been the topic. Poor choice in choosing book for the class. Alright professor, clear in expectations. 7.5/10.

Great prof. This was my second time taking 220 and it was so much better. I felt like I actually learned something this time and the lectures were much more straight forward. Both Vienna and Payten (TA) were fast to respond in emails and they are both very nice! I wished more teachers were as nice!
A lot of assignments that take 5-8 hours to complete that are only worth 5% of your grade which u had to complete and hand in to pass.
Didn't find him very helpful, or available for help, however I took the class through Distance ed, so maybe he's a better teacher in an actual class.

Valerie is a very nice prof and she loves to share her knowledge and experiences. Her quizzes were quite easy and were open book so if you read the chapters you will do really well. The term paper was 8-10 pages so a bit long but manageable.
She is a little more strict on grading but you can definitely do good in her course if you put in the work. Dont know why she's rated that low tbh it's crazy.

Honestly, she was very fair in terms of marking. The two midterms and final were based solely on the slides, which were organized and clear. The final paper can be extensive, but if you follow the instructions and treat them like a checklist, it's relatively easy to do well on the paper.

An ok prof, lectures are useless as she reads off slides, all exams are based on lec slides nothing is pulled from textbook readings. No question asked three day extension for research proposal if you complete a short article summary. Grading is a bit tough, not too crazy. Tut participation is 15%. Would take again if needed.

Chelsey is a fairly good prof. As others have said, I wish she put a bit more personality into her teachings. I got to know her more during office hours and she is actually a very interesting and knowledgeable person, but she fails to let that shine through in lectures and tutorials so they are quite boring. Very tough grader for a 200 level course

Chelsey isn't a bad professor I just wish she would let her personality shine through slightly more. Yes, she reads off the slides sometimes but she also gives plenty of opportunities for further questions. She sometimes alludes to her own experiences but it would be nice to hear a little more. Solid professor imo. Also, you get 15% in tutorials!

Lectures are so mind numbing and dull, she just reads off the slides and no effort to be engaging. Two midterms, two papers, and a final. Extremely tough grader. The paper for this class is ridiculous for a 200 level class, 14-18 pages asking to make a research proposal as if you are a professional researcher. This class is my 13th reason.

I do not like her at all. Her lectures are so bad due to the fact that she basically reads of her slides, her tutorials make me want to just get up and leave. On top of that the course material makes me want to transfer out of crim. Quite literally the WORST prof and course ever.
W prof, the best CRIM prof SFU has to offer. Understanding, caring and his Russian accent makes him even cooler. Would 100%% take his class again. Recommend him at all costs

Super easy! questions given weekly (answer using the textbook). He chooses 6 short answers out of these, 10 mc, 5 t/f on mt + final. Also gives answers to t/f + mc, so easy to memorize. Never attended a lec. Paper kinda hard (my topic = poverty + crime rates), overall minimum effort class + highly recommend.

OH MY GOD! I took this class as an elective but I got an A in this class. I always got 20% above the average. The teacher is so caring and kind. He is always there to accommodate you whenever you need. The exams were easy as hell. Straight memorizing. Make sure you attempt the practice exams, they were extremely helpful! I'm very serious! Must take

Dry and hard to understand, It was two exams and a research paper, the paper is easy and broad, but time consuming. The exams are easy because he gives you the list of questions that will be on the exams so all you have to do is memorize them. If you have to take this class and want a decent grade without going to a single lecture, do it with him.
cant understand a word he says. challenging professor, not kind. very lazy slides, assignments too challenging for what it is

It can be hard to understand him sometimes, but he's unintentionally funny. His lectures are posted online and summarize the textbook well. He basically posts the entire midterm and end-of-term online, and it's just memorization to prepare for them. I was late for the end-of-term test with 25 minutes left, but he let me take it.

He is so cute. Straight-up grandpa vibes. It's a little hard to understand him because he has a strong accent, but tests are straightforward and he sends a question bank beforehand with what he's gonna put on the exam. He's always helpful when you ask him questions.

Nikolay Shchitov is extremely disorganized, and the grading criteria are very unclear, when asked in person about the criteria he gives each student a different answer when we asked the same questions. He does not communicate with the TAs, so they don't know what to do either.

Proffesor Shchitov is an amazing lecturer, who cares for his students and wants them to succeed. He gives out the midterm/final questions out beforehand. All you need to do is memorize them since they're all fair game. Also make sure to answer the questions he posts for lectures, it'll help you for your exams.
Seems to want his students to succeed. Study from the list of questions he gives for exams, it is extremely helpful that he gives it out.

a bit hard to understand at times, has interesting stories, gives out a list of questions prior to exam which is pretty fair, if you go over the list you'll do fine. seems like a nice guy who wants to see you do well!
Crim 220 isn't a easy class. Long 20 plus page assignment due at the end of the semester. Overall good prof. Very good lecturer, but very serious prof.

While doing evaluations, Quote: "Folks, I know I'm disorganized." Funny.. if you knew, why did you never finish a lecture? And fyi, changing our midterm date without our permission is against school policy, especially the week before. Never take a class with this guy.

One word: AWESOME! He gets his students and can relate to them. Doesn't expect you know what he doesn't teach which is a plus, always willing to help you out even if he has to go out of his way, there needs to be more professors like him! Ignore the comments above, of course you will do bad if you don't put the effort in and jay tells you that.

Horrible, horrible and horrible. He never actually finishes a lecture, just goes off on his own tangents. Yes, he likes class participation, but I think he needs to be reasonable. We aren't going to have something to say on every single slide like he expects. Midterm was hard, even for a take home, and he changed this the week before. Horrible.

i dont know where to begin. first his midterm was take home, but the wording and question format were horrible ... went against the proper questioning techniques he himself taught. second, he never finishes his lectures, lack of powerpoint and notes, often gets distracted, and the list goes on. dont take this course with him

She's an okay prof, very knowledgeable about the material. Doesn't post slides most of the time. Midterm average was very low and told us before that most people fail the midterm and it is hard, however if you do 10% better on the final, she will make the final worth more. All SA and LA on exams. TA made the course better. Research project a pain.

Hilary takes so much time to mark and criticize (in a good way) your papers so you will do better. I've never had a prof at SFU who takes the time like she does to help her students. She turned a dry subject into the class i'm most excited to attend this semester. If you want to do well in school, she is the best person to help you do that.

Hands down the worst prof ever! Any questions you had he replied with "read the textbook" or "check the syllabus on Canvas". The course was all textbook based and his lectures were dull and monotoned. He was rude and no help. Definitely don't recommend

Sigh... Do you have a question? "Read the textbook."  Unsure of what to study? "Read the textbook?" Do you like taking notes in class? Don't bother, he goes through the slides before you can even write down half a word. There's no point in asking him to return to the previous slide since "everything you need to know is in the textbook."
failed after putting in so much work and now I am retaking the class.

Dr Wong is very intelligent and tries to explain concepts well. She appears intense in front of the class, but is very kind when speaking to you one-on-one. She posts lecture slides, but attendance is important. You have to write a research proposal (~18 pages) which was graded harshly, however they do provide a detailed rubric.

If you attend lecture and take some time to study material you're fine. She does talk fast, so I'd recommend taking notes on the lect slides before lecture and then adding notes. TA was Chelsey she gave really good feedback especially if you particiapate in class it helps you prepare for exam q's! If you took psyc 201 before this should be easy!

This professor is the only teacher i celebrated to be done with she does not teach the course material well and if you don't understand “her language” you will have to repeat the course as some people I know had to.

slides were not posted, attendance mandatory. I recommend you take this class with other professors. Had lots of papers and tutorials requires participation for full marks. TA was very helpful with papers, however proof lacked heart when presenting. seemed very strict and too nonchalant. lectures not engaging, questions for midterm/finals tuff.

Whatever you do, DO NOT take any classes with this prof. She makes her tests way too difficult, marks way too hard, and doesn't even post slides. A large amount of information on tests comes from readings which is also extremely frustrating. AVOID

Has a high sense of pride, refuses to change anything related to the course to benefit students. Didn't post lecture slides, had quite difficult tests, and you could generally tell she was doing the bare minimum. Tbf to her, CRIM220 shouldn't even be mandatory course for crim students, a lot of the content is relatively useless and unrelated.

Dr. Wong's lectures are interesting as she does go into details of each points on the slides. However, slides are not posted so you must attend lectures if you wanna understand the materials. Read all of the required readings since some of it will be on the exam. Study EVERYTHING before the exam as well, because there's no study guide provided.

Her tests were fair and the research proposals were not very hard. Asking Dr.Wong questions was also helpful because she would properly explain what she wanted. The only negative thing about this course is that the lecture slides are not posted, this makes it harder to write down what she is saying

Attending lectures is very necessary if you wish to pass this course, even if the slides are very minimal, and Dr.Wong provides very little explanation, you must attend. 

Additionally, TA's mentioned that Midterm and Final information is based more on what is said during lectures, and not tutorials, textbook info, and basically anything else.

If she's not going to post audio recordings or lecture slides for us to access.. AND expects us to be able to type and follow along while she talks in 2x speed, can she at least wear a mic so we can hear her.

She does not post lecture slides on canvas or audio recordings. She expects you to be able to listen and type at the same time, while not understanding some people cannot keep up or learn that way. She talks very fast and does not wear a mic so it is hard to hear her. Paying $700 for a course that doesn't even allow access to the course materials..
Crim 220 wasn't too hard a class. The paper was daunting but the guidelines made it easy to complete. Lectures weren't very interesting, but exams were fair.

I was scared going into the course but I actually loved her class. The content is boring but she knows her stuff and gives good examples. She is very straight-forward and organized. Expect to actually work for an A. I wouldn't say she's hard, but very fair. Would take a course with her again.

The content in this course really sucks, though she makes it crystal clear with plenty of examples. She's very nice and approachable despite her sometimes frightening demeanor. Midterm and final were exactly as she described; wasn't out to trick you or anything.

I don't know why people say she's so difficult... The course's content is awful and she makes it manageable thru her awesomeness. Try and get into her tutorial! Only downside is she will get to know your name and call on you in lecture! Amazing prof and so nice! She makes you work fr your grade but you learn a lot.

People are accustomed to profs handing them As with no effort, but for Jennifer's classes you actually have to try. Her exams are very fair if you ACTUALLY prepare. Read the textbook, focus on her notes too, and you should get an A if you understand it. Paper instructions are very clear. 220's content is heavy & dry so go talk to her, she very nice

Intimidating at first, but she's actually super nice and really helpful in office hours. As long as you don't fall behind and put in the effort on the paper, you'll get a good mark, and focus on her lecture noted for the tests. Highly recommend her!

Was scared to death before the first class cuz the reviews are so bad here. But she is awesome. Class was interesting enough for a research methods class. She is super helpful and nice. Attend all lectures and write everything=that's what will be on the exam. Amount of work might seem as large, but it's broken down pretty reasonable.
Talks extremely fast. Appears quite harsh, but is quite nice.

Not a bad class...very boring material but as long as you attend lecture and take good notes, you will do well.  The 15 page paper wasn't too bad since the instructions are very detailed and clear. Would recommend her, she seems like a hard-ass, but is actually nice and not too difficult.

Also in 103 with her this semester as well. She gets a bad rep from a lot of students. Her tests are fair if you study, she gives lots of chances for bonus! oh, and LOVES LISTS, seriously if theres a list it will be on the exam.As well the 20 page paper may seem heavy, but her assignments lead into it. Also very approachable in office hours!
Previous post: Sorry! I have her in Crim 220 (Surrey). Fall 2011

Jen Wong knows her material extremely well. Most of her classes are research methods and statistical analysis so don't expect to be on the edge of your seat. However, this material is essential if you plan on doing any type of study in the future. For tests, focus on her lectures. Assignments are fair. And as a bonus, she is absolutely gorgeous.

Great Prof! Only thing to complain about-talks very fast hard to copy notes and write down examples. Textbook was useful only for supplementary source of info FOCUS ON HER LECTURE NOTES 4 EXAMS! 20 pg paper-clear instructions very helpful USE OFFICE HOURS I did and ended up with an A! Very approachable if you visit her during office hours!
Professor who knows what she's talking about and is willing to work with you if you're willing to learn.

Dr. Wong may speak fast but she sure is not completely useless. I think the ones who find her hard are the one who do not attend class as no lectures notes are posted. i do agree midterms and papers are difficult, she seems to test a lot of detailed information from EVERY chapter. although the material is quite boring, i feel she did supply us with

lectures are boring and she talks too fast.. she doesn't clarify the material and just rushes through the notes..also FOUR papers to do in total!! she's nice in person but for the course and ur marks.. dont take it with her.. has a nice/good TA though.
TALKS TOO FAST, UNCLEAR, TALKS ON AND ON... and on...and on.. not much interest showed towards crim 220, so take it with Barry if you can! u won't regret it!
A really good teacher! She is straight forward and if you do the readings and pay attention you will do good. The midterms are tricky, but overall a good course, lots of information.

She talks so fast that she hands out traffic lights for students to signal her to slow down! Although she seems to know her stuff, lectures were all her notes (which were helpful though!). It's dry material to get through for 2hr lectures but its not horrible. 4 papers in total to do, midterm and final.

she just doesn't know how to teach! you can never catch on to what she is saying or anything. her exams are super hard for an intro course and her marking style is horrible. she never clarifies what is going on and is never clear at all. just overall not a good prof.
she reads directly from her notes like she doesnt know what shes talking about. As well she doesnt engage the class or try to make things interesting. She talks wayyyy too fast
i've had a few classes with him and he is so easy and so funny. he makes the class interesting regardless of what the topic is. exams are usually nice and quick and straightforward.

Professor Carleton has been an incredibly affective teacher. I enjoy how she can bring personal experiences in the CJS to the class, which increases understanding of current issues. Dr. Carleton always made herself accessible to students for additional help. The essays were testing but educational and the testing was fair.
She is faced with the task of teaching some heavy material, but is more than able to pull it off. On top of it all, she is simply stunning. Two thumbs up.

Lots and lots of revised syllabuses. Her 220 course isn't bad, and she definitely is very passionate in what she teaches. Better than her 321 course for sure, and the feedback she provides during the seminar is solid. Honestly, if you study and do the readings for this one, you'll probably do well enough. Still wouldn't recommend though.

Professor Fennig was the best prof I ever had, not only does she care about her students but she gives out plenty of reminders and tips to succeed in the course. Because of COVID it was remote but she made it super easy for her students and was very understanding during these circumstances.

Dr. Fennig is a patient and responsible professor, she is always being happy to help students even on weekends. Her expectation and instruction are clear. However, she is also the strictest prof that I've ever met so far. She covers lots of materials in every lecture - so make sure you are well-prepared and study very hard throughout the semester
Best prof ive had so far, cares so much about students and goes to extra lengths to make sure everyone understands

Dr. Fennig is one of the most caring professors (and people for that matter) that I have ever met! She definitely makes you work hard but as long as you put in the effort and work hard, you can do well in her class. She gives great advice and feedback as long as you make use of her office hours and extra help sessions.

Tamie is one of the best profs I've had at SFU! She is the most caring prof who takes the time to make sure you understand the material. I was nervous about taking 220 online but I am more than happy I took it with Tamie. The final paper is based on very specific criteria so make use of her prep sessions for full clarity! Tamie is a lovely prof!

It's obvious that she cares a lot about her students, but she has a tendency to ramble and frequently deviates from the actual course material. Long papers with super specific requirements. Be prepared to hear about how handwritten notes are superior nearly every lecture.

Even though Prof Fennig is a strict and tough marker (100MCQ midterm, 150MCQ final), she is a genuine prof who is ready to help her students succeed. Make good use of her office hours! I promise, you cannot find any other professor as caring as her. If she has to, she will spend more than 1 hour with you to ensure that you understand the material
Her constant reminders and her constant full detailed emails and the rubrics really helped a lot during this semester.

She genuinely cares about students. I do not understand why people leaving bad reviews because she was giving out study tips on how to succeed in learning. She gave out crystal clear instructions and tell you exactly how your paper will be graded. She is a very hardworking prof and really wants the student to succeed and have a good time learning.
Very good prof, I would definitely recommend to take a class with her. She's really clear with her instructions and tells you literally what she's looking for when marking.
Tamie is so lovely and helpful! Exams are a little heavy (CRIM220 is not easy itself anyway), but you will be fine if you have studied enough. Definitely would take with her again!

The most caring prof in a along, long time. Exams are based on specific details and all multiple choice. Two long research proposals, however she always has extra office hours. Reads every bit of your paper and gives feedback. Tough grader, but if you follow her and do as she says, you'll get the desired mark.

Tamie is a very caring person. But her grading expectations are very high. Directions aren't entirely clear either. The text for this class is also brutal and hard to read. Tests are all multiple choice based on very specific details with answers that all seem possible.
Tamie is a lovely lady, just absolutely tough on tests. Take a class with her if you're taking a light course load because she's gonna make you work for it.

Tamie is a very respectable and caring prof who honestly wants her students to succeed. However, she has very high expectations from her students. The tests and paper in this class were absolutely brutal. You literally have to memorize hundreds of pages of notes to get a good mark. The average for the midterm was 55%, and she expected a 75%. Eh.

Best instructor I have ever met in the criminology department. She is extremely caring, and passionate about criminology. Her exams and grading criteria are straightforward and easy if you study and review. She genuinely wants her students to succeed and do well in class. Would take her again 100% for sure!!!

Prof seemed genuinely interested in helping students and engaged in the material. Midterm and finals are both out of the book and the notes so know both and they are detailed - there will be little things to trip you up. Proj. was ok but kind of lame, but as long as you put in the effort the marking isn't hard.

Do not take this class with him! Extremely boring lecturer, and super difficult to communicate with due to his way of answering questions. He has the worst communication skills ever. Mid-term marks were super low and he is not open to any suggestions.

if you want to drop your gpa then take this course. He'll bend the rules screw you over on the exam. Average was around 50% for mid term he had to bump it up or something. TAKE IT WITH SOMEBODY ELSE. I'm being real and not saying this to scare you. It's a fact! WORST PROF IN SFU BY FAR. His laugh is also very scarey

He's not a good prof at all. His exams are really tough. Average was so low he had to boost it by 10%. By far the most inconsiderate prof I've ever had. When you discuss your project with him, he doesn't tell you what he's looking for so basically your handing in the paper with no clue. I'm a 3.8 GPA student and I got a C+. BIGGEST GPA FLUNKER CLAS
Such a good teacher!! She makes a required, dull course interesting. She is very clear and always willing to clear things up.

Amazing instructor! Super helpful if you go to Marie's officer hours or even contact her by e-mail (very fast at replying). She provides a lot of feedback in general and the tutorials, which consist of group activities, will help clarify important concepts covered in exams. The course material was quite dry, but not too bad in terms of difficulty.

Rylan is the best prof I've had at SFU. He lays out clear expectations for the semester, and honestly cares about students, their grades and wants everyone to succeed in the course. Lectures are mandatory as the exams are almost 100% based on his lectures and he does not post his slides. But if you show up and take notes you'll pass with ease.

possibly my favorite prof so far. he is very funny and engaging, and he's very clear about what he expects from you and how you can achieve it. the textbook is required but he will tell you exactly which sections to read. his dog is very cute and she is my best friend

Rylan is a phenomenal professor, I've had him as a prof for two of my courses. He highlights exactly what you need to read in the textbook for exams so you don't have to waste your time reading everything. He tests heavily on lecture material and examples he gives in class. If you attend lectures and study what he tells you, you will do well.

One of the best professors I've had. He's straight forward and tests based on lecture material. Of the little readings that he expects from us, he announces and highlights the topic that he wants us to read on, and even includes the page number and chapter where the information can be found. Very clear grading criteria and is very respectful.
Really nice guy, caring. As long as you attend lecture and study you will be fine. Fair grading and tests, no trick questions

Very fair & transparent prof. If you attend lectures then you will pass. Lectures are easy to follow, tells you what will be on exams, no tricks or surprises on exams. Paper is 9 pgs but easy. Tutorial was fun and TA's were great. Dr. Simpson is very caring about students success & well-being in this course. One of the best profs, highly recommend!

Love this Prof! Probably the best one I've ever had so far!! Rylan is extremely transparent about what he wants from the students and assignments. His midterms and finals were everything he mentioned that's going to be on it, there are no surprises! 

I wish I could get Rylan as my prof for all my classes!! :)

great prof! exams were fully based on lectures so show up to class and you will do fine one the exams. Exams were fair and easy and maddie was a great TA. i would love to take a class with Rylan again. He uses policing alot in his examples which can get kinda boring as I dont care about policing, but you can tell he loves what he does 10/10

Show up to lecture and give an honest effort and you will do well. Rylan will make it very clear on what he will test you on. His lectures are organized, and follow a clear line, making them easy to follow and take notes. TAs are told to mark generously and the feedback they give is valuable.

His teaching style and care for students is rare in comparison to most profs, it's clear to see his passion for research and made lectures fun. Pacing was perfect & provided lots of examples. Lecture is everything for midterms/finals, textbook is supplementary UNLESS he says certain sections. Super fair assessment, term paper was simple. Very easy.

he's literally the g.o.a.t of the crim department, take his class, material was super easy to follow, midterm was a little tough but he does not play with u or trick u, tells u what will be on the exams. TA was super nice, participate in tut for marks, research paper was only 9 pages unlike other classes w 20. solid guy.

I never write reviews but, Dr. Simpson is absolutely AMAZING! I have never had such a straightforward prof who genuinely sets his students up to succeed. His midterm format made me want to cry happy tears because I couldn't believe how to the point it was. You have to show up to class because he doesn't post slides but not the end of the world.

The content is boring but Rylan is nice and good at delivering his information. Slides are useful but you will need to read the textbook to pass the midterm/final. Make sure you remember his examples in lectures because it will come on the exam. He uses iclicker which is annoying but doable. TA was really nice too so overall a good course.
Miss Rylan! He was such a caring professor, wish there were more profs like him! His lectures were actually fun and even brought in guest lecturers by Zoom. Make sure to pay attention during lecture.

Amazing prof! Genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Lectures are straight forward and he wont move on till he knows everyone understands the concept. He made the transition to online school easy for his students. Rylan's class was enjoyable, definitely recommend as a prof to look for during course selection! 15/10

If you need to take 220, please take it with Rylan. The usual 20+ page research paper is only 9 pages in his class. His exams were very fair and never tries to mess with you, during lecture he'll point out what will be on the exam and what won't. Only downside is that he doesn't record/post the lectures but he's very open to feedback!

my fav prof at SFU so far!! He makes very boring materials seem interesting in his lectures. His tests are very easy if you go to every lecture and if you pay attention. He's such a nice and caring guy, excited to take another class with him!

Given the circumstances of having to teach via zoom, he did an amazing job teaching. He was easily accessible outside of class and responds to emails quickly. Slides aren't posted online and term paper outline/criteria was a bit broad. But other than that, a really caring professor that wants to see his students succeed!

Crim220 with Rylan was an absolute treat. For a class that is typically pretty dry and boring, he makes it very fun to attend lectures. Ryan was also an amazing TA. Would recommend this prof for any class

One of the best professors I've had. He really wants his students to succeed and he knows the class content well. His exams are also super fair, and the guest speakers he brings in are interesting. Definitely hoping to take a class with him again.

An incredible professor. He cares so much about his students and is by far my fav prof at SFU. He told us what kinds of things to look out for exams and gives a very clear criteria for the research paper He doesn't post slides/lectures, but honestly GOOD! It forces people to come to class and pay attention. We're in university, be responsible guys

Prof Simpson doesn't post recordings of his lectures or copies of his powerpoint on canvas so if for whatever reason you miss a class you're screwed. He also goes through slides very quickly. The material is pretty boring which makes it hard to pay attention. Our term paper is worth 25% and we've only had one weekend since receiving feedback

Rylan is probably one of the best profs I've had at SFU. You can tell through his material that he is so invested in his work and truly cares. He specifically states that he's not here to trick you on exams, and uses his lectures to prepare you accordingly. GREAT PROF 10/10.
